inlineContent.text: This tutorial guides you through creating, updating, querying, and deleting ToDoitem with DataStore.
to manipulate ToDoitem using Amplify templates.
button. Now that DataStore manipulation file is created and
is the main file to deal with ToDoItem.
In the ToDo app, you’ll implement the class
and add DataStore manipulation functions into it.
: a non-optional bool variable that controls changes of the view.
: an optional ToDoItem variable that store current Todo item information.
Create a logger file to monitor various actions.
will be used to display information after actions.
You need a function to create a ToDoItem and save it to DataStore.
. This function receives a toDoItem and saves it to DataStore.
to display as high, medium and low.
Add the log codes to monitor the save action and the
to update the ToDoItem in DataStore.
Find the index of the toDoItem.
Check the index to know whether the
to determine whether the item exists. If the item exists, it will update the existing item. If not, it will create a new item in DataStore.
You’ll create a function to query all ToDoItems in DataStore which are displayed in the ToDo list.
. This function is called when the app launches and queries all
in DataStore and stores them in
You’ll create three functions to remove ToDoItem based on different situations.
and delete it from DataStore using
from DataStore when a certain amount of time is reached after they are completed.

You just reached a very cool checkpoint. You have a fully featured CRUD application that saves and retrieves data in the local device, which means the app works without an AWS account and even without internet connection.
